TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit RelationshipManager extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Used to track relationships between objects in the object context.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager> is used to track relationships between objects in an object context. There is one instance of the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager> class for each relationship tracked in the object context. Relationships are defined by associations in a conceptual model. For more information, see [Association Element (CSDL)](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/c305169a-8af7-432f-9ba7-800a163aed41).
## Examples The example in this topic is based on the [AdventureWorks Sales Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832). The example adds new `SalesOrderHeader` entities to the `Contact` entity. Then it gets all related ends from the `Contact` entity and displays the relationship name, source role name, and target role name for each related end.
[!code-csharp[DP ObjectServices Concepts#IRelatedEnd](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/CS/Source.cs#irelatedend)] [!code-vb[DP ObjectServices Concepts#IRelatedEnd](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/VB/Source.vb#irelatedend)]

.method public static hidebysig class System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager Create(class System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithRelationships owner) cil managed
Public Shared Function Create (owner As IEntityWithRelationships) As RelationshipManager
public: static System::Data::Objects::DataClasses::RelationshipManager ^ Create(System::Data::Objects::DataClasses::IEntityWithRelationships ^ owner);
static member Create : System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithRelationships -> System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager

Docs.param: Reference to the entity that is calling this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager.Create%2A> method is used by objects that implement <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithRelationships>. When Object Services requests the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager> property of an object that implements <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IEntityWithRelationships>, the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager.Create%2A> method is called if the relationship manager does not already exist for the object.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IRelatedEnd> GetAllRelatedEnds ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IRelatedEnd> GetAllRelatedEnds() cil managed
Public Iterator Function GetAllRelatedEnds () As IEnumerable(Of IRelatedEnd)
public: System::Collections::Generic::IEnumerable<System::Data::Objects::DataClasses::IRelatedEnd ^> ^ GetAllRelatedEnds();
member this.GetAllRelatedEnds : unit -> seq<System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IRelatedEnd>

Docs.summary: Returns an enumeration of all the related ends managed by the relationship manager.
Docs.returns: An of objects that implement . An empty enumeration is returned when the relationships have not yet been populated.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager.GetAllRelatedEnds%2A> method returns an enumeration of <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityCollection%601> and <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityReference%601> objects. <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityCollection%601> and <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityReference%601> are concrete types that derive from <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelatedEnd>. The <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelatedEnd> abstract class implements the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.IRelatedEnd> interface.
## Examples The example in this topic is based on the [AdventureWorks Sales Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/f16cd988-673f-4376-b034-129ca93c7832). The example adds new `SalesOrderHeader` entities to the `Contact` entity. Then it gets all related ends from the `Contact` entity and displays relationship name, source role name, and target role name for each related end,
[!code-csharp[DP ObjectServices Concepts#IRelatedEnd](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/CS/Source.cs#irelatedend)] [!code-vb[DP ObjectServices Concepts#IRelatedEnd](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/DP ObjectServices Concepts/VB/Source.vb#irelatedend)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks Gets an <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityCollection%601> of related objects that have the specified relationship name and target role name.
The relationship name should not be namespace qualified. An error occurs when you prepend the namespace to the relationship name.

Docs.exception: The specified role returned an instead of an .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is intended to be used in scenarios where the user does not have full metadata, including the static type information for both ends of the relationship. This metadata is specified in the <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EdmRelationshipAttribute> object on each entity type in the relationship, so the metadata system can retrieve it based on the supplied relationship name and target role name.
The relationship name should not be namespace qualified. An error occurs when you prepend the namespace to the relationship name.

Docs.exception: The source type does not match the type of the owner.

is invalid.
-or-
Unable to find the relationship type in the metadata.

Docs.summary: Initializes an existing that was created by using the default constructor.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager.InitializeRelatedCollection%2A> method initializes an existing <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityCollection%601> that was created by using the default constructor. The <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.EntityCollection%601> is initialized by using the provided relationship and target role names.
The <xref:System.Data.Objects.DataClasses.RelationshipManager.InitializeRelatedCollection%2A> method is used during deserialization only.

Docs.exception:
When the provided is already initialized.
-or-
When the relationship manager is already attached to an .
-or-
When the relationship manager already contains a relationship with this name and target role.

Docs.param: Describes the source and destination of a given serialized stream, and provides an additional caller-defined context.
Docs.summary: Called by Object Services to prepare an for binary serialization with a serialized relationship.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Serialization of relationships is only supported for binary serialization. Complete object graphs, including relationships, is not supported for Windows Communication Foundation and XML serialization. For more information, see [Serializing Objects](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/06c77f9b-5b2e-4c78-b3e3-8c148ba0ea99).
